usage: A data frame with 82 observations on the following 14 variables.
reference: The goal of this investigation was to test the relative importance of geologic, geomorphic, and other physical factors that have led to levee failures through the past century along much of the Mississippi River.
description:
Description
Factors relating to Mississippi River levee failure
title: Levee Failures along the Mississippi River

parameters.ConstrictionFactor: Constriction of the floodway over time (1880s to present)
parameters.ChannelWidth: Width of the river channel (in meters)
parameters.Revetement: Is there a stone structure (wall) meant to hold up the bank?  (1=yes or 0=no)
parameters.Sinuosity: River length divided by valley length for 10 miles up- and down-valley from levee site
parameters.FloodwayWidth: Width of floodway (in meters, levee to levee, levee to bluff, or bluff to bluff, as appropriate)
